subject: Hockey, Ice
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: The Boston University senior defenseman Matt Gilroy received the Hobey Baker Memorial Award on Friday night as college hockey’s top player. Gilroy is the second Boston University player to win the award, after the Rangers’ Chris Drury in 1998. Gilroy was selected over his teammate Colin Wilson, a forward, and Northeastern goaltender Brad Thiessen. Gilroy walked on as a freshman but is now a team captain. The Terriers play Miami University on Saturday night in the N.C.A.A. title game.
